newsitem.title: INDONESIA: AT&T, Telkom in $26.9 mln deal.
newsitem.headline: AT&T, Telkom in $26.9 mln deal.

text.p: U.S.-based telecommunications giant AT&T Corp. said it signed an agreement on Friday to supply services to Indonesia's state-controlled telecommunications firm PT Telekomunikasi Indonesia (Telkom).
"The agreement, called the IMS On-Site Support and Implementation contract, is worth more than $26.9 million and is being implemented over 16 months in 1997-1998," AT&T said in a statement.
Under the agreement, AT&T would provide its expertise to help Telkom's management in the fields of network planning and operation, fraud prevention and interconnection, it said.

"We are confident that AT&T's 100 years of experience in the telecommunications business will help PT Telkom to position itself for the next 100 years as a world-class telecommunications provider," John J. Legere, president and chief executive officer of AT&T Asia/Pacific, was quoted as saying in the statement.
Telkom is also listed in New York and London in addition to Jakarta.
